sentences.sentence: Media Liberty Group Reporters Without Borders is ringing the alarm on the state of press freedom around the world in its latest global ranking report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Israeli forces and Palestinian groups in Gaza have agreed to a ceasefire after Israeli airstrikes pounded the coastal enclave all night.

sentences.sentence: A second Russian freight train has been derailed by an explosion in a region close to its border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hollywood television and movie writers have launched their first strike in 15 years after a breakdown in pay negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Paris-based NGO Reporters Without Borders has released its annual Press Freedom Rankings Index and its conclusions are clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Media freedom is in a dire state in a record number of nations and journalism is under threat from artificial intelligence, propaganda and disinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: With the advent of the digital era, the entire information landscape has changed, of course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Digital platforms have given us countless new ways for us to inform and express ourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But they are also providing fertile ground for those who sow disinformation and conspiracy theories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We find ourselves at a new crossroads Norway remains the country with the freest press followed by Ireland and Denmark France gained two places and is ranked 24th Brazil also progressed with the election of President Lula da Silva Vietnam China and North Korea are at the bottom of the ranking Russia lost nine places and is currently at the 164th position. According to Reporters Without Borders, the Middle East-North Africa region remains the most dangerous for journalists, in contrast to Europe, which is still the easiest for reporters to work in. Overall, the conditions for practicing journalism are poor in seven out of ten countries, according to the organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Israeli forces and Palestinian groups in Gaza have agreed to a ceasefire after Israeli airstrikes pounded the coastal enclave all night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: According to anonymous sources from Palestinian armed groups Hamas and Islamic Jihad, the ceasefire went into effect at 3.30 a.m. local time and was brokered by Egyptian, Qatari and United Nations officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The death of a high-profile Palestinian prisoner in Israeli custody after a hunger strike of nearly three months set off a barrage of rockets from the Gaza Strip, raising fears of a further escalation. Israeli soldiers have been deployed with their tanks along the Gaza border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: While the targets hit by Israeli fire are as of yet unclear, there was evident damage to a car and house in the southern Israeli city of Sderot from Palestinian rockets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Militant Palestinians accused the Israelis of deliberately assassinating Khader Adnan by refusing him medical care while in their custody.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Adnan, who was a senior figure in Islamic Jihad, had been charged with terrorism offenses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Israeli prison officials say he refused their medical help while he was on hunger strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The fate of Palestinian prisoners in Israel is a top issue for their families and political leaders who hold Israel responsible for their well-being.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There are said to be some 4,900 Palestinians in Israeli prisons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The leaders of Serbia and Kosovo have agreed to cooperate on identifying and locating hundreds of people still missing from the 1998-99 war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The pair are meeting in Brussels for talks on implementing an EU plan to normalize ties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But the EU's foreign policy chief, Jozef Borre, has admitted that on other issues the two sides remain apart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: More than 11,000 Hollywood television and movie writers have begun their first strike in 15 years after talks with studios and streamers over pay and working conditions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: failed to clinch a deal. It means writers throughout the entertainment industry are putting down their pens and shutting their laptops. The results? Late night shows will be reruns while television series and movies scheduled for release later this year and beyond could face major delays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For several years now, the writers have been making less money and less money on what traditionally has been a long Hollywood tradition, which is called residuals, where you get a check that comes to you every single time your show airs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So if Netflix is running your show, you know, if people are streaming your show a million times on Netflix, you aren't necessarily getting compensated in the way you would have back in the good old days of 1990s broadcast television.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so those checks have gotten smaller and smaller.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For the majority of writers working in the entertainment business, it's become harder and harder to make a living, particularly as the cost of living in New York and Los Angeles rises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But there is a warning. The last writer's strike is thought responsible for creating more unscripted television, such as The Kardashians and Celebrity Apprentice with Donald Trump.
